block.p: An article on the Street Scene page in Business Day last Friday about the International Network of Boutique Law Firms rendered incorrectly a word in a quotation from the founder of the organization, Steven Spielvogel, who commented on his experiences as an associate at Sullivan & Cromwell. He said, ''When I carried a Sullivan & Cromwell litigation bag and it said S.&C. on it, it was a rebuttable presumption that you were an amazing lawyer and brilliant'' -- not a ''reputable'' presumption.

He said, ''When I carried a Sullivan & Cromwell litigation bag and it said S.&C. on it, it was a rebuttable presumption that you were an amazing lawyer and brilliant'' -- not a ''reputable'' presumption.
